page.title: 15Living near the Air Base
page.content: About{8.20a.m.}you hear the first roar of the{plane engines}starting up.Usually they are the{Harrier Jump {Jets}which can take off vertically. Sometimes a jump jet hovers over my house and that is the noisiest thing of all! It quietens around midday,for lunch I suppose,but half an hour later the engines start to scream again. {Helicopters}fly to and from{Portland {Navy Base. Around 5p.m.the last of the day- flying planes come in.They are the planes used as targets by ships.The thing I really hate is the{night {flying}because then I just can't get to sleep. At weekends you can see{gliders}and hear the whistling sound when the tow rope drops. It's very noisy living near the Base but very interesting.
